stanza.line: Be wise as thou art cruel do not presspress
My tongue-tied patience with too much disdaindisdain
Lest sorrow lend me words and words expressexpress
The manner of my pity-wanting painpain
If I might teach thee wit better it werewere
Though not to love yet love to tell me soso
As testy sick men when their deaths be nearnear
No news but health from their physicians knowknow
For if I should despair I should grow madmad
And in my madness might speak ill of theethee
Now this ill-wresting world is grown so badbad
Mad slanderers by mad ears believed bebe
That I may not be so nor thou beliedbelied
Bear thine eyes straight though thy proud heart go widewide
